titleStmt.title: To the right honourable the Lords and Commons now assembled in Parliament the humble petition of many of the gentry, ministery, free-holders, and other inhabitants of the county of Kent; the city and county of Canterbury, and other corporation within the said county agreed on at the generall quarter sessions, holden at Maidstone Aprill 20. 1642.

notesStmt.note: Petitioners concur with the city of London repudiating the late Maidstone petition. They thank the House for its labours to prevent the King going to Ireland .. -- Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
